title: [Self-Directed] Causal Reasoning in Complex Social Systems: Understanding Through Connections and Analogies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Social System Structures, Data Interpretation Skills, and Fundamental Probabilistic Thinking Concepts
context.additional_context: Training elementary education practitioners to analyze complex social phenomena (e.g., policy impacts, collective behavior) through probabilistic causal relationships

learning_goals: Derive at least three models explaining causal relationships in social systems from a probabilistic perspective
Connect inferential reasoning to the impacts of distributed agents, spatiotemporal gaps, and time delays on outcomes through real-case analysis
Visualize causal characteristics of complex social systems and interpret statistical patterns via project-based assignments
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
